Confirmation from President Joe Biden: President Biden confirmed that former President Donald Trump left a note for him, describing it as "generous." This confirmation adds credibility to the claim that a note was indeed left behind.
Social media misinformation debunked: The claim originated from a tweet that falsely stated that no note was left by Trump for Biden. Fact-checking organizations, including FactCheck.org, worked with Facebook to debunk this misinformation and confirm the authenticity of the note.
Eyewitness accounts: Both President Biden and White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki confirmed that they were present when Biden received and opened the letter from Trump. Their firsthand accounts provide additional evidence to support the authenticity of the claim.
Tradition of the transfer of power: The letter from an outgoing president to the incoming president has been a longstanding tradition during the transfer of power. While Trump broke other traditions by not attending Biden's inauguration, the existence of the note aligns with this customary practice.
